intro: Lampranthus walgateae, commonly known as the Walgate's ice plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant produces bright yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Lampranthus walgateae is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in dry conditions.
